title: Pleasant Township, Hancock County, Ohio
text:
Pleasant Township is one of the seventeen <a href="civil%20township">townships</a> of <a href="Hancock%20County%2C%20Ohio">Hancock County</a>, <a href="Ohio">Ohio</a>, United States. As of the <a href="2010%20United%20States%20Census">2010 census</a>, the population was 2,471, of whom 823 lived in the unincorporated portions of the township.
Geography.
Located in the northwestern corner of the county, it borders the following townships:
The village of <a href="McComb%2C%20Ohio">McComb</a> is located in eastern Pleasant Township.
Name and history.
It is one of fifteen <a href="Pleasant%20Township%2C%20Ohio%20%28disambiguation%29">Pleasant Townships statewide</a>.
Pleasant Township was organized in 1835.
Government.
The township is governed by a three-member board of trustees, who are elected in November of odd-numbered years to a four-year term beginning on the following January 1. Two are elected in the year after the presidential election and one is elected in the year before it. There is also an elected township fiscal officer, who serves a four-year term beginning on April 1 of the year after the election, which is held in November of the year before the presidential election. Vacancies in the fiscal officership or on the board of trustees are filled by the remaining trustees.
